intro: Hexastylis virginica, commonly known as the Virginia heartleaf, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and woodlands. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora. The plant's unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
